name: tua_phidu_2015_lga_aust_community_strength_2014
title: LGA15 Community Strength - 2014

legal.licenceType: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Australia (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0 AU)

keyword: public health information development unit,strength,lga profile 2015,cultural acceptance,discrimination,volunteer work,tua,support,safety,community strengths,torrens university australia,phidu,community,
abstract:
Modelled estimates of community strengths including: voluntary work, giving or receiving support in times of crisis, feeling safe, views on accepting other cultures and receiving discrimination, 2014 (all entries that were classified as not shown, not published or not applicable were assigned a null value; no data was provided for Maralinga Tjarutja LGA, in South Australia). The data is by LGA 2015 profile (based on the LGA 2011 geographic boundaries).
Note: A number of the estimates were not presented in the data due to constraints placed on them and therefore received a null value. For more information please refer to http://www.phidu.torrens.edu.au/.
Source: Estimates for Population Health Areas (PHAs) are modelled estimates and were produced by the ABS; estimates at the LGA and PHN level were derived from the PHA estimates.

selectedAttributes.name: cul_2_asr
selectedAttributes.title: Disagree with accepting other cultures ? ASR per 100 population
selectedAttributes.description: The estimated number of people aged 18 years and over who disagree/strongly disagree with acceptance of other cultures (modelled estimates), 2014 ? Indirectly age-standardised rate per 100 population (Indirectly age-standardised refers to adjustments made through comparisons against the relevant standard Australian population).

selectedAttributes.name: discrim_past_yr_2_asr
selectedAttributes.title: Felt discrimination in the past 12 months ? ASR per 100 population
selectedAttributes.description: The estimated number of people aged 18 years and over who, in the past 12 months, felt that they had experienced discrimination or have been treated unfairly by others (modelled estimates), 2014 ? Indirectly age-standardised rate per 100 population (Indirectly age-standardised refers to adjustments made through comparisons against the relevant standard Australian population).

selectedAttributes.name: gsup_2_asr
selectedAttributes.title: Support in time of crisis ? ASR per 100 population
selectedAttributes.description: The estimated number of people aged 18 years and over who are able to get support in times of crisis from people outside the household (modelled estimates), 2014 ? Indirectly age-standardised rate per 100 population (Indirectly age-standardised refers to adjustments made through comparisons against the relevant standard Australian population).

selectedAttributes.name: saf_2_asr
selectedAttributes.title: Feel safe walking alone in local area after dark ? ASR per 100 population
selectedAttributes.description: The estimated number of people aged 18 years and over who felt safe walking in their local area after dark (modelled estimates), 2014 ? Indirectly age-standardised rate per 100 population (Indirectly age-standardised refers to adjustments made through comparisons against the relevant standard Australian population).
